acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 5 days EC50=0.9 mg/L of the aquatic plant (Lemna Gibba) (AQUIRE (2008)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since LD50 value of the dermal administration test employing rats was >5,000 mg/kg (JMPR (1995)), it was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It is a solid whose saturated vapor pressure level at 20degC is 1.8*10^-6 mg/L. Although LC50 value of the inhalation exposure test employing rats is >29.1 mg/L (JMPR (1995)), classification is not possible since exposure time is unknown.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: From a description of LD50 value of >15,000 mg/kg (JMPR (1995)) in the oral administration test employing rats, it was classified into "Not classified".

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since the European Union classification was Cat. 3; R40 (EU-Annex I), and it was described that the 18-month oral administration test employing male and female mouse showed liver cell cancer and the 24-month oral study employing male and female rats showed Leydig cell tumor, adenoma in adrenal gland (JMPR (1995)), etc., it classified into Category 2.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there were no rapid degradability (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: It was classified into "Not classified" from the description of negative (JMPR (1995)) in the in vivo heritable mutagenicity test (dominant lethal test employing a mouse) employing a germ cell. Moreover, there are also descriptions of negative (NTP DB (Access on October 2008)) in the in vivo genotoxicity test (SCE test employing a hamster spermatogonium) employing a germ cell and negative (JMPR (1995)) in the in vivo mutagenicity test (micronucleus test using mouse peripheral blood) employing a somatic.

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound not containing oxygen, fluorine or chlorine.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: There are data showing a stability at up to 50degC (HSDB (2003)).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In an oral multigenerational study in rats (JMPR (1995)) it is reported that the substance caused infertility in males due to feminization of external reproductive organs in the F1 generation male offspring (100 mg/kg group) at doses at which general toxicity is not observed in mother animals, suggesting that the substance served as an androgen receptor antagonist. For the reasons stated above, it was classified as Category 1B. It is also reported that 12 out of 15 animals which were administered 800 mg/kg miscarried in an oral administration study in rabbits (JMPR (1995)). Incidentally, the EU classification is Cat. 2; R60-61 (EU-Annex I), and it is equivalent to Category 1B in GHS.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Although the unsaturated bond is included in chemical structure, classification is not possible with no data.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: From a description of "not irritating to the eyes" in the eye irritation test employing rabbits (JMPR (1995)), it was classified into "Not classified ".

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Although there is a description of slight, momentary irritation in the 24 hour dermal stimulation study with 50% liquid using rabbits (JMPR (1995)), classification is not possible, because the liquid is not 100% and the study time is out of standards.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from a description of "suggesting sensitizing" (JMPR (1995)) in the Maximization tests employing 12 male guinea pig. In addition, it can be classified as R43 (EU-AnnexI) in the European Union classification, which is equivalent to Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, adrenal gland)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There are descriptions of the necrosis, hypertrophy of liver, tissue disorder of adrenal gland (JMPR (1995)), etc., and of the lipid droplet of the distal convoluted tubule of the kidney, extension of a kidney pelvis, a water ureter (IRIS (1992)), etc., in the repeated oral administration test employing mice, rats, and dogs. Since these influences were seen within the range of the guidance value of Category 2, it was classified into Category 2 (liver, kidney, adrenal gland).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data
